Our neighborhoods from areas surrounding Imperial Palace to South of Market and in between are not blessed with nice looking restaurants with decent enough looking dining facilities especially for special occasions without driving across town.  I disagree with other critics unaccustomed to authentic Chinese dishes.  Americanized Chinese food is tolerated by most Chinese restaurants to placate Americans with limited cultural gastronomical experiences. But whereas the dining rooms are clean enough, their restrooms and kitchen areas remain filthy. Too bad because I appreciate several of their uncommon menu choices one can only find in restaurants willing to cater to diners seeking cultural authenticity as I do.

Unfortunately, most other Chinese restaurants in this city barely go beyond an 80 health code rating either. But those very obstinate proprietors are determined to help China spread bacteria contamination with filthy restrooms and food stored near filthy parts of the restaurants. Maybe these restaurant owners believe that their restaurants should be a breeding ground for innovative new food source by homegrown bacteria and enriching the diets for rats and roaches.
author: Lizabeth G.

description:
I used to come here for dim sum on Saturday about two times a month. Both food and service was above average. I had no complaints. However, they decided to remodel and now there's a little bit more space and it's more "high class" (or so it seems compared to what they used to be). Hopefully they're still working on all the kinks but the food has definitely went down. It's not bad but it's just not as good as it used to be. Most things we ordered were a bit bland. 

Service wise....there was this really impolite waiter who had black rimmed glasses and fobby hair. He's younger than most of the other waiters so not too hard to recognize. In the beginning when we were waiting for our table, he tried to give our table to a bunch of his friends. However there was another more experienced waitress that saw and told him to give us the table. Dude...c'mon now, if you're gonna do that, at least make it less conspicuous -.- He was sooo obvious about it. 

Then later, I asked him for some napkins and he totally forgot about them. Or he just didn't want to service us. When we asked for the check, he was the one to bring it back to us and he just threw it on the table. RUDE RUDE RUDE.

He needs to be fiyad.
author: Judith L.

description: Arrived about 11ish on a random Saturday morning for some dim sum with my Mommy and Grandma.  No wait.  They had a table for the 3 of us available right away.  Plus, the ladies came around with a decent selection of dim sum.  The dim sum wasn't bad, but I can't lie and say it was good.  I'd come again if we needed to grab a quick dim sum brunch in the neighborhood.
author: Christina L.

description: Ive never had such bad service before in any food establishment. This is saying a lot. Ive dined out a lot and the waiter just straight railed on us and was very blatantly rude. I am straight appalled how we were treated. Im an ABC too, and I understand that one doesn't typically go to a Chinese restaurant of low caliber and expect good service. With that said, we would've been better off serving ourselves... It ruined the whole meal. If your waiter is an asian man with receding haired mid aged man, request another waiter.
author: Gina T.

description:
This place currently has a "Grand Opening" sign, and their Chinese name now includes the word for "new" added in front.  I don't know how "new" it actually is, but currently it getting packed even on a weekday afternoon for lunch, something that wasn't happening before.  I notice they did some remodeling by putting in a new dining area, and word from a coworker is that they hired a new chef.  Other than that, I see the same people who appears to be the owners as before, but I do see someone new who I think is the owner of Riverside Seafood on Vicente Street.  Maybe this is a new partnership.

Anyway, at least the dim sum seems good.  My coworker and I enjoyed the chicken feet in black bean sauce more than before, and a different coworker said she enjoyed the dinner and her husband like the dim sum better than before also.  The menu has also changed from before, both the dim sum lunch and the dinner menu.

For that, I'll give them the benefit of a four-star review.  Hopefully the current management can keep the customers coming this time around unlike the previous setup.
author: H K.

description:
YAY they had a parking lot! I must've been totally out of it this morning because I left my back window OPEN. Thank goodness nothing was stolen! AND i accidently left my phone in the car too! They have a guy watching the parking lot though.. maybe that stopped anyone from sneaking around the lot.

It's sad.. but, although i'm asian.. it doesn't mean I can fluently speak it :( I only recognize the words for "fork", "tea", and some miscellaneous dim sum dishes. All the employees at Imperial still assumed I spoke Chinese even though I was answering in English with a confused look on my face. I guess I need to pick up a copy of Rosetta Stone: Cantonese 1.

The dim sum was so/so. I've had fresher tasting dim sum before - especially since we're in SF and there are so many GREAT dim sum places! The black bean spare ribs were a bit odd, the egg tarts were so flakey it fell into pieces the moment I picked it up, and the char siu was a little different tasting than I'm used to.  On the bright side, the restaurant wasn't crowded and our group of 4 was seated promptly! I probably won't go here again but it wasn't bad or anything.
author: Samantha L.

description:
After the yelp reviews I read of this place,
I admit I went in expecting the worst.

The food itself really wasn't bad at all.  It also wasn't great, but nothing to send you to the restroom. The restaurant however was DIRTY.  Dirty as in the entire interior really needs to be gutter and remodeled. 

The carpet is literally threadbare and was dirty enough that your feet stick to the floor in places.  The cloth table cover and clearly not been replaced from the previous customers who sat at our table as dried food was stuck to it where I sat.  The glass of the lazy Susan had been wiped with a very dirty cloth and the wipe marks had dried, leaving a trail of where previous grease had been evenly smeared about.  For inexplicable reasons, the walkway into the restrooms was lined with cardboard boxes that had been opened flat and used in place of carpets.  As if that weren't odd enough, signs had been posted on the walls in Chinese warning you to be safe and not trip while walking.  Perhaps they meant to not trip on the cardboard boxes they had put down on the ground?

The food was fine and the service was decent.  For the same quality food an service though I would highly recommend any other place with a better janitorial service.  After seeing what I did, I shudder to think what must be going on in the kitchen.
author: Megan L.

description:
My dad and I live in the hood and decided to give Imperial Garden a try and see what it was all about.

When we first entered the establishment, it was completely empty. We ordered a somewhat large amount of food for just the two of us - but we like our leftovers. The food came out in a pretty speedy fashion and everything was good. Nothing special. But after looking at the menu and seeing the prices for the food, I was expecting much better. 

The food was average, but the service was HORRIBLE. It all started when our wong tong soup came... My dad likes to have white pepper with his chinese food and when he asked, the waiter smiled and nodded, but the pepper never came. We had to ask for water - which was never refilled. Our fried rice never came during the meal - as we were about to leave, my dad says, you can keep the rice, and sure enough within two minutes it was brought to our table - only to be put in a to go box, as we were fished eating( it was probably sitting on the counter for a while).

Overall, disappointed. Wont be back.
Worth the gas money to drive to Happy Chef in Burlingame instead.
author: Dana D.

description: Supposedly they have a new owner. don't know if the kitchen/chefs stayed the same, but the food wasn't too bad. They also have some lunch specials like chow mein and fried rice for less than 10 bucks. I would check it out again since it's so close to where I live.
author: Sappho C.

description: We came here for dinner. Sat down, ordered, and waited 40 minutes for food to come. Half of the tables that night were having a banquet party, I guess most of the labor went into that, so the other tables were screwed. We kept asking the waiters why it took them so long, they just kept giving us false hope. In the end, we finished and gave 10% tip, the waiter yelled at us saying it's not enough, it should be at least 15%. Unbelievable.... Chinese restaurants got good food, but they always get bad reviews because of their bad service.
author: Alex Z.

description:
We had dim sum here. The food is okay. Nothing spectacular at all. Just another close to home place to get dim sum cause we were carving for it. 

Nothing wowed me at all. The porridge was bland. The inconsistency of taste of food made it a 3 star. I
author: Hei Ming C.

description: It's unfortunate this place gets to monopolize the neighborhood's chinese food business. My family comes here for dim sum on weekends as it's within walking distance and offers bigger table than the other chinese restaurants on the block. But the food quality is mediocre, restroom is nasty, services are below average, and prices are definitely not a reflection of what it offers. Most unpleasantly the waiters are just downright rude and demanding tips for their lack of customer services. How annoying is that!
author: dodomomy Z.

description: Food was pretty decent. The interior is huge. Street parking and a small lot.
author: Jboogie L.

description:
I remember when this place used to always be packed. My dad and I came here for lunch at noon on a Friday and there were only about four tables filled. Parking was difficult to find and we ended up parking at a space with a 30 minute time limit so my dad had to keep going back to put more coins in. 

We ordered off of the dim sum menu instead of waiting for the ladies to come out with trays of food (which they rarely did btw). Because we had no visuals, we ended up ordering way too much food. We ordered six dishes which I will try my best to name in English:

Sweet Tofu Soup: I asked for no sugar on this since I had Splenda in my bag. Haha. It was great but this isn't the type of things anyone could really mess up on. Its like soft silken tofu and water. The lady kept insisting to give me sugar and asked if I would like it on the side. 

Stuffed Mushrooms: I'm always paranoid they're going to be stuffed with meat but it was just fish cake. The sauce they poured on top of it was disgusting. Not only was it thick and goopy, it was virtually tasteless as well. It was like someone sneezed all over them. I ended up wiping off all the sauce on those paper placemats and it wasn't until afterwards I realized how unsanitary that was since they don't change them often. Yuck. 

Mai Lai Cake (Steamed Sponge Cake): This is my dads favorite thing to order at dim sum places and it quickly became my favorite. Their portion was really small though but it was pretty good. Some parts were kind of oily though which was pretty off putting. 

Shrimp Dumplings: These were brought to us last and I was already stuffed to the gills. We didn't want to bring anything home so I struggled to eat three of them while my dad ate the forth one. The first one I tried to pick up completely fell apart. The skins are really chewy on these. 

My dad also ordered Steamed Chicken Feet which I went no where near and some porridge. 

It was $23 total which I thought was pretty reasonable but my dad kept saying how expensive it was and how he'll never be back. He said it used to be cheaper. 

Here's a funny story. Once when I went here as a child, I found a penny on the bottom of my water glass as I went to take a sip. Yeah, thats right, A MOTHERFUCKING PENNY.
author: Tiffany V.

description:
This place is way overprice....

the only time i been here was when my relatives came from China and we wanted to go dim sum close by home and this was the only place within miles. ( i guess that is why everything is so expensive) anyways, we came here in the morning and this place was DEAD... nobody here. we order dim sum and they tasted OK. However, when we ordered beef chow fun and fried rice. That is when things started going downhill. The beef chow fun was around 12 dollars.. Are you serious!!!!!?!?! Moreover, It wasn't even that good!!!!  I can get a plate of beef chow fun for $5!! after that time, i am definitely not coming back to this place ever again.
author: Daniel L.

description: I come here for nearly all Chinese holidays and special occasions, not by choice. The food is generally good. Service can be hit or miss depending on occupancy and the bathroom is groooss.
author: Cindy T.

description: Usually dim sum is quite packed on weekends around noon and service can be quite slow.  This place was fast, relatively cheap, and the food was as good as other dim sum places.  Nothing spectacular here but if it's quick, efficient, and you get your dim sum fill for a reasonable price (at least I did).  I would come back jut because I hate waiting when I have a dim sum craving.
author: Michael L.

description:
This is a type of restaurant where you will see a lot of locals and contractors dining.  The food is decent and your expectations should not be high when eating here.  It's not Koi Palace nor is it a hole in a wall restaurant in Chinatown.  It's more like a Gold Mountain, Clement st dim sum house.

Notable items that were good were the shrimp fried bean curd ( suen jook keurn) and the beef roll.  Everything else was just average.  Came here with a group of friends so we got to try a bit of everything.  It's a cool place if you were just to grab something quick, reasonable, and if you are around the neighborhood.  They do have a parking lot for their customers.

Service..........quick to please and with a smile.
author: jason g.

description: Ok, a little expensive for what you get. Plus was the steamed black bass which was just right. Minus was the suckling pig which was bland.
author: Calvin L.

description: I've been here many times when I was younger and the service has extremely changed. My family and I have always received great service, but today was different. The odd thing that changed was the food carts being pushed around. I haven't been here for years and so when I walked in, it was weird to see them walk around with trays. There were a few servers who just came to our table several times with the same food items. It got annoying after a while since I was waiting for other items to be presented. I did ask this one server for chicken feet and he got it for me, but that twas about it. It just seemed like I had to speak Chinese to get the items I wanted because most of the servers didn't understand the food item in English, even though it was listed on their menu. There menu did have pictures, but I felt it was too scattered and that it needs to be helpful for the customer and server. After 15 minutes, my husband and I got tired of waiting for water and other food items to come around so we left. We enjoy dim sum and usually have at least 6 dishes on our table, but today was a disappointment because we only ordered 3. The total came out to be $15.50 and I didn't think it was worth it at all. I certainly will not be coming here again.
author: Chan Chan T.

description: I've been here a couple of times. I don't think the dim sum is that great for the price they are charging. I could eat for the same price at Koi Palace or Hong Kong Flower Lounge (Mayflower). I only come here because my relatives live around here and we meet on weekends to dim sum. The waiting time is awful, even though they opened up the second floor. However, on the second floor there isn't much dim sum served up there. Mainly, because they probably don't want to walk two flights of stairs carrying dim sum around. Overall, the food is just average. They could charge lesser for the quality of dim sum they are serving.
author: Elaine C.

description: First time at this place for dinner and it will be my last. The service is ridiculously slow even though there weren't that many people. We got about 6 different a la carte dishes and had to wait about 30 minutes before we even got one of them. Everything on the menu is overpriced for the portions and the quality of food. The flavor of the food is OK, but I would expect more for paying ~$15 per dish at a poor to mediocre Chinese food restaurant.
author: Kevin H.

description: Under new management for several months now.  Been here several times with family.  Very solid, very reliable dim sum,  Nice neighborhood place.  Try cheung fun- fish and BBQ pork both very good.
author: Susie M.

description: I've been to this place 2 times since the new owners. I echo the same complaint about the pricing. You can't charge for 4 star food when your a 2 star restaurant. The dim sum today was a rip off. $95 for 6 people, and we didn't really order anything special, no lobster or fish. One order of roast pork belly, this was the most expensive, soy chow fun, Chinese mustard greens along with a few dim sum dishes. Food was really average. I will not be back!
author: K M.

description:
I've been coming here since I was a kid, which is not long since I'm not even an adult yet but that's not the point. This place has changed a lot since I was a young toddler. I can remember it like yesterday; the clothes used to be pink instead of green; there were more flies in the restaurant than there is now; the dishes' plates look more refined; the staff used to talk to use more often. I guess there are good and bad changes over time.

The food, however, has somewhat stayed the same. I still order the fried pork chops for dinner because this place fries it the best out of all the restaurants I've tried it at. This place is expensive for my parents (one dish during the evening hours is about $9 or higher) so we only come here now when my parents and I celebrate something good, like our birthdays and other special occasions. 

During the Dim Sum hours, on the other hand, is pretty chaotic. We hardly come here for Dim Sum because the place is pretty packed (although we haven't eaten Dim Sum here since summer ended.) There are specific dishes I like to eat here, such as this fried-crab dish with a side-dip of mayonnaise and the raddish cakes. 

As much as I miss how it was back then, I think it has improved over the years.
author: Vicky P.

description:
i tried to find their new name... NEW imperial garden on yelp... but it's not there... this place does open for dinner... 

forwarning:  becareful of this place as they are sneaky.... 

came here to dinner with family, as our family friend suggested this place.  then when we sat down... they were talking about how this place is shady... stating that they sometimes over charge if you dont check the bill... i'm like what the heck are we doing here?!?!?! 

we started ordering... the waiter started his sales pitch on their special soup of the day... my mom caved in and ordered it.  he stated that it would be enough.  when we were done ordering... waiter comes over and sets up the soup bowls... and then said, you need to order two of the soups since one only serves 6 people and you have 10... WTF!?!?! he just said that it was enough!! shady.... 

the other food arrives... we ordered this tea chicken dish (whole chicken) and it comes out with half tea chicken... half steamed chicken because apparently they didn't have enough of the tea chicken... but they never asked if it was ok to sub the other half with the steamed chicken... SSHHHHAAADDDYYY!!!

will i ever go back to this place? HELL NO!!  the food is not good... the pricing isn't super cheap... the place is understaffed...  

there are WAY better chinese restaurants in SF to waste your time and money on this place... 

let me be your lesson learned and go elsewhere!
author: Kelly H.

description: This place was good, but overpriced in my mind. Expect to see some strange items on the menu, which is a great menu; pictures of every dish cover all 50 or so pages.
author: James N.

description: This is officially the worst dining experience I've ever had. Because it was their grand opening since new management, the place was jam packed with people. Understandably they wanted to seat us upstairs in their second floor loft. However, they had a dozen large bags of dining linen blockading the bottom of the stairs and we had to climb over them just to get to the top. This is a serious fire hazard especially to my grandpa who needs a cane to get around. The upstairs loft that we sat in was basically a storage room for their employees that they decided to open up last minute to shuffle in business quickly. The corner that I sat in had a row of large metal lockers with dirty towels poking through their shutters, much like those rusty ones in high school hallways. The carpet beneath us had so many dark stains that anything is imaginable. I literally only took one bite and immediately felt sick and wanted to haul my ass out of their. We requested to speak to their manager but the waiters told us repeatedly that he was "busy". If you're too busy to care about your customers, especially since you've only recently opened, then you can surely say hello to an angry patron expressing his thoughts on Yelp. I've posted some photos in the photo section to warn anyone who is thinking of coming here not to come. Ask yourself this, can you eat in an environment not unlike that of a third-world back alley?
author: Raymond N.

description: i think this place is under new management, but its crowded here especially on weekends during lunch, bc this is the only dim sum place in this neighborhood. the prices are fair, but the food quality is just okay. if i come here, its usually for dinner and just for porridge
author: Long C.

description: I will give them no star if I could!!!!! Bad restaurant I had ever seen. I went today morning with family and while we were eating, there were 2 spiders moving on the table(within 1 hour). The waiter kill one with paper towel, and the manager kill one more later!!!!! And the attitude is super bad.. After I tell the manager and ask he do sth to protect the customer, and he said and I quote" we don't have spider, we dont have spiders on table,you go ahead call the police or whatever, we don't care.  "  I pay no tips for such bad attitude, I pay for the food though. Even though the food is not so good, I eat some so I pay 4 it. But  I will never go there ever again. If u like eating with spider, you can go.
author: Cindy C.

description:
We went to this hole in the wall on 3/18/12 for dim sum. We only ordered a few dishes before getting up and leaving. Here is my story...

-We ordered the Shredded Pork and Egg Porridge - very bland (how can you mess this up?)
-Next one of the waiters tries to push the Suckling Pig on us, he said it was good and you should try it. He puts that dish on our table and I immediately tell him to take it away. I hate restaurant workers being pushy and forcing me to eat dishes that are of no interest to me.
-We ordered the chicken feet - it was OK, but I had better at most other places
-We ordered the tripe - was bland and tough to chew
-We ordered the shrimp dumpling and that just pushed us over the edge. My wife found a piece of metal inside the dumpling. We told the manager or some guy with a cheap black suit and he said that was from a cleaning brush...WTF? He asked if we wanted to order something us. I said, "Take it off our bill and check please!" Shortly after, some other guy approaches our table and offers to give us something else. We say, "No and check please." 

It takes them a while to give us the check, most likely on purpose just to piss us off even more.

I agree with other Yelpers and this place sucks due to their food, preparation of their food, piss poor customer service, pushiness and over-hyping their crappy food as they make their rounds around the place.
author: Andi L.

description: Ever since their renovation, they have lowered their prices and may have changed their management? I'm not sure but for sure they've gotten so many more customers and tastier food after the revamp. My family has frequent the place for both lunch and dinner over 5 times! They're at a pretty good advantages going one of the only tea houses in the neighborhood.
author: Judy C.

description: First time eating here. Had roasted goose and fish porridge. Nothing much to compliment. I think the roasted goose was not fresh because skin was so chewy, not crispy. The services were okay. Our waiter was pretty nice.
author: Evan L.

description: It's like old man winter in here. I guess they want us to eat the food quickly before it freezes. Ordered the lobster lo-mein and  got a really dead lobster, the lobster meat was like mush. Order the roaster pig, average quality, small plate, and hugh price ($13). Owner really needs to do a quality check and turn on the heat.
author: Henry L.

description: Food quality has improved greatly since I've been here last. Their flavors are more traditional and portions are good. The staple dishes are solid. Shrimp dumplings, siu mai, black bean pork ribs, and braised chicken feet are all tasty. Everything else is hit or miss. Still overpriced but it's the only dim sum place in the neighborhood so that's to be expected.  I come here every once in  while when we don't feel like gathering everyone together far away.
author: Sannie L.

description: This place is somewhat edible but not something I prefer. Reason for two stars is because the boss is F'n annoying. I came here with my girlfriend for dinner and the owner never left us alone. He kept insisting that whenever we get married, that we should hold our banquet here. I shrugged it off but he came by several more times to bug us about the banquet. The food is over-priced for the quality. Dim sum here is terrible as well. I can tell the workers receive harsh punishments for not selling the food. It's impossible to eat in peace here. It's also very obvious the boss is a complete ass to his workers and customers.
author: Ryan L.

description: Noting fabulous about this place. Change of ownership recently and the food got a little better. I'll be eating here every weekend if Koi palace or The kitchen should take over this location.
author: C B.

description: I came here for a friend's wedding, the bathrooms were covered with cardboards on the floor but the wait staff was very attentive. the food was (typical chinese wedding dishes), would like not be coming back but since the waitstaff was great, I bumped it up one.
author: Tiff W.

description:
We live in the hood and have driven past this place a million times and wondered what it was like. After reading Yelp reviews we decided to try. We went on Sunday evening. Dim Sum was done. We ordered off of the menu. We had Chow fun, won ton soup, glazed prawns and walnuts, and black cod. We ordered a black cod dish off of the menu, the waiter talked us out of the one we ordered and recommended a different one. When it came , we were in shock, it was like chicken nuggets but with cod. We wanted a nice piece of fish, not nuggets from a fast food place. Just because I am white, doesn't mean I want my food fried. 

The won ton soup was less than mediocre. We had to add soy sauce to everything. So bland. The same food at Ling Ling , down the street blows away this food. 

The wait staff was awful. They never actually stopped at our table, always rushing past. We won't be back. Check out Ling Ling if you want the best glazed prawns and walnuts!
author: Keri V.

description:
some of the food is good, 
but it is expensive, 
and unless your speak Chinese, the service SUCKS!
the ladies who brought around the different Dim Sum should at least speak some English?!?
There was ONE guy in a white shirt and tie that was friendly, but the guys in black vests and the bow ties were rude to many people...

we won't be going back...
author: C J.

description:
What should you expect from a dim sum house?  Hopefully not service.  Most of what you eat comes off of a cart being pushed around by screaming ladies...

That being said, the food here is pretty decent...

But what the hell is up with the prices?  Most of the dim sum items cost over $5, and most of their noodle dishes were $9 and up!  Who the hell would pay $12 for chow mein?  You'd be better served to try your luck in Chinatown...
author: Nathan W.

description:
*** Flashback 1 year ***
Midweek dinner: EMPTY restaurant
Waited on by the Manager and 1 busser... entire restaurant still empty
Food comes quickly, enjoy food, chat... one person picks up take out*
Pay for meal, box up extras, exit

*Another visit: there was one other small family that came to dine in.

Odd having a HUGE place void of patron, but the food was fine when you don't want to cook :) 
Overall 3 Star
*** Return to present ***

Change of ownership or partnership as of the last month, same amicable manager. So when I walked in a bustling room, I was genuinely happy for them...

(Granted it is a holiday and it was packed, so that may effect my updated review.)

Food tastes good, portions small for a Chinese restaurant, service confused but trying. 

We ordered the $138 menu option.
+ All the favors were good
- Portion size: in some cases barely enough for everyone at the table to try a bite
- Service: Had to aggressively flag down people (again, holidays busyness makes it hard.) & reminders to fill requests
+ Parking: Easy, plenty of evening street parking & a private small lot
- Missing ingredients? Stated on the menu...but not in the dish that arrived?

I hear this place is packed out for dimsum both upper and main floor.

I'll have to try this place another time... on a non-holiday.
author: Angel L.

description:
I found Imperial Garden on Yelp when I was looking for a spot to have dinner with my boyfriend and my auntie.

The food was good. The portions were good for the price we paid. But the service SUCKED. My auntie asked the waiter for a fork because she doesn't know how to use chopsticks and he comes back with a bunch of serving spoons. WTF?! And it was already difficult enough as it was to get a server's attention when we wanted to order. 

Don't think I'll making a return visit any time soon, if at all.
author: April P.

description: Don't go at 1:30pm or after. Not any new food going around.  Either order off menu or go somewhere else.   Rugs are still same rugs from last restaurant and are dirty.  I won't be going back.
author: Fun T.

description:
I've been coming here recently since this restaurant had a new manager. I'm not going to lie, the food does taste better than before with the old manager. 

Every time I come here, the service seems to be different, even though it's crowded and there's a lot of people. Today when I first sat down, tons of servers were asking us if we wanted food. But soon, after 10 minutes, this lady stopped asking us. I said "excuse me" because she was carrying something I wanted and she didn't even bother to turn around or stop at my table. Talk about being rude. I'm sorry lady, I didn't like what you were carrying before but I like the item now. Kill me if I don't order everything. 

The line for the bathroom was long (typical...for every restaurant) so I was just patiently waiting with all the other people... until the lady who usually serves you to your table came in. She loudly announced that she came into the bathroom 3 times already and there's still a long line. So she decided to cut everyone just so she can go first. Hello, some of us are waiting to go to. I expected better from someone who works here. You would normally always want to satisfy your customers first, right?

The food service here is alright. The food is constantly serving but it's not Dim Sum. It's always bread or some cold cut food that doesn't take time to prepare since it's pre-made. If you want to eat a variety of dim sum, you really do have to order it on the paper. I also ordered the Grilled Leak and they gave us the wrong order. It was definitely not the same as the picture shown. The picture also shows 5 pieces but we only got 4. That's definitely a rip from a "special" food item. 

Overall, my first few times here (when they first opened with the new manager) were better than my last few times. Maybe they're just getting tired of all the people everyday...
author: Jackie L.

description: If I can give this place zero stars I would! This is a review that's long overdue: we came here on Mother's Day for dinner because my parents live close by. Figure it's convenient. Now I wish we had of taken the time and gone else where. We called and made reservations. Got seated and was served the menu. They inflated the prices on everything! I realize it's Mother's Day and most places would charge more but it's ridiculous what they did. The had set menus for you to choose. Prices were tripled and some were quadrupled compared to their usual menu. The food was not good. Service was terrible. We paid $175 for a crappy meal which would have cost no more than $60 on a regular night. Waiter told us they will serve us the free desert after the dinner. We paid our bill and tipped them (which we should not have but given it's a holiday, we did). We sat there for 15 minutes after they took the bill, money and tip and no one came back. No one came back with the dessert. Finally we just left.  A friend of mine told me he found a slug in his food once...I should listened to him and stay away from this place. It's amazing this place is still open. I think the only reason why it's still open is because there is a large Chinese community around the area and they just go there because it's convenient.  I will not be back that's for sure!
author: A C.

description:
Overpriced, unpleasant service, nasty food.  There, I have concluded my experience here. 

Waited more than an hour for the food to come, the waiter said there's computer glitch that the kitchen didn't get our order.  That is BULL since tables around us all got their food, it's obvious that the waiter did something wrong.  No apologies, and the food was so bad that some were overcooked and some were undercooked.  I wouldn't pay for this kind of food even for half of its price.
author: Veevee Y.

description:
3 stars,

Definitely not the greatest dim sum place. But food and prices are decent. 

The service is okay. The dim eh its alright. The noi may gai (sticky rice with sausage and beef) was very plain and barely had any meat.

Eh I'll come back because i still haven't found anywhere better
author: Jackson P.

description:
Anyplace with a parking lot in SF automatically gets a star in my book.

That said this place is not the newest, shiniest or most modern place. 
But it's clean, it's not overly crowded and it's not overly expensive.

The food is good, and you can eat a ton for a really reasonable price.

We pigged out here and it didn't even put a dent in our wallets.

For that they've won me over.
author: Denise B.

description: Made a phone order on Monday morning for pickup which I thought would be pretty convenient. Ordered shrimp fried rice, sweet and sour pork, kung pao chicken, combination chow mein, and an order of pot stickers. We were told that our order would be ready to pick up in 20 minutes. We arrived at the restaurant after the 20 minute mark, were promptly greeted, but did not get our food until well over the 40 minute mark. We waited over 20 extra minutes in the restaurant waiting for our food which was time we could have spent ordering inside of the restaurant and starting on our food. I was extremely dissatisfied with their phone ordering system and do not recommend it. Upon opening our orders we found that our combination chow mein had NO MEAT and was so so! I was even more dissatisfied with the restaurant as a whole. The shrimp fried rice was bland and mediocre. The sweet and sour pork, kung pao chicken, and dumplings were pretty good. Overall, I wouldn't return seeing as they took such a long time, got one order wrong, food was mediocre, and the bill came out to over $60. Next place please.
author: Briana G.

description:
My family comes here to yum cha once in a while on Sundays. Best time to go is around 12, going too early means not much selection. The last time we went, within three minutes of being seated, we already filled our table with dim sum. The ladies with the carts and trays just kept coming! It was like a human sushi boat chain, but with delicious dim sum.

We come here because it's so close to our house, it's pretty good, and we don't have to wait for a table. They have a small parking lot which can get filled once they get busy. The guy who watches over the parking lot looks like an Asian Leon (the professional) heh
author: C. Z.

description:
I always passed this place by because I felt wierd going in alone or with just my husband to a place that looks more suited to serving huge parties, mostly Chinese families on nights and weekends.  Huge stone lions flank the door with a tank of large koi is just inside.  Necco wafer pink table cloths, which I have come to associate with Hong Kong style restaurants in SF.

But when I realized they served dim sum, I dragged my husband and a hapless houseguest in to see how it was...wow!  Very inexpensive and very good!  The usual dumplings, plus some other dishes I had not seen.  Heavy on the shrimp, some pork, did not see any duck or squid, but if we had asked they would have provided.  They brought a delicious steamed brocoli dish out especially for us.

Their regular menu is kind of pricy.  My husband ordered noodles and egg rolls for takeout once when I was out of town and it was $20!

I am so glad I no longer have to brave the search for a parking spot in the Richmond, or pay Yank Sing prices, to get my dim sum, so I give it the extra star because I can walk there!
author: Holly B.

description:
This place spells rip off. If it was a literal rip off, your wallet would be torn by now. After trying the dim sum, I think I'd rather hop on the 9x on the corner and head to Chinatown for much cheaper and tastier dim sum.

Dim sum here kinda sucks, definitely could be better for the price.
author: Natalie G.

description:
ive been to a few dim sum spots around the city, south city, and daly city, and i think this is the best one ive been to.  The pricing is so awesome, we went with a group of 13 the first time we came, everyone was full, and it was still so cheap.

The food is great, the food isnt oily at all like other places and the dim sum just seems so fresh.  my girlfriend and i want to make it a tradition to come here for brunch once a week or so, i think theyre that great.  oh yeah, and they got a stage area which is my favorite sitting.  ahahah, just kidding.

hit it hard my friends.
author: JD B.

description:
I love living in a city where you can have whatever you feel like for breakfast. It's Sunday morning and many folks are having the usual
bacon and egg breakfast but not me.....no sirreeee! I'm having shrimp
dumplings, stuffed eggplant, pork buns and sticky rice wrapped in lotus
leaves. I would give Imperial Garden another .5 star if I could. The service is good, the tasty tidbits make me smile with every bite and the
prices are very good. I'm getting hungry just thinking about it.
author: Cindy J.

description: Dim sum and lunch in general is very expensive here!  This is a travesty considering the neighborhood.  How can you charge Koi prices at a neighborhood like this?  Food was ok.  I'm more turned off by the price!
author: Wendy H.

description: What can I say about this place? Bad service, bad food, and terrible prices. Seriously, it feels like I'm being robbed every time I come here. I thought after they changed management the food would taste better. Silly me, to think such a thing! The first time I came here, my mom had been telling me how the dimsum changed and tasted better and all that jazz. After the positive review my mom gave, I decided to join her for dimsum on the weekend. What a mistake! The dimsum was tasteless, the servers mugged me, and tea was never refilled. However, WORST of all was that the lobster lo mein. DO NOT get it. The noodles were wrong, the lobster pieces were sparse and it tasted like it came from one of those cheap Chinese frozen dinners.  I was pissed beyond words when the bill came; it came out to be nearly 100$ for a couple plates of dimsum and a plate of the WORST lobster lo mein i ever ate. With that being said, I will NOT be coming back any time soon even if I live (literally) right behind it!
author: Celina C.

description: I came here for lunch, even the name is change to NEW imperial, the service and food are still have a lot of room to improved, foods are not worst for this price,
author: ken l.

description:
Ok, I have to give the Imperial Garden a bonus star to balance some of the negative reviews  I see here.

Imperial Garden has a wide variety of dim sum dishes and rather good service (for a Chinese establishment). My friends & I go here regularly and find the food & price to be reasonable.

The restaurant has a parking lot, but it is small and usually full. So, do be prepared to hunt down parking on the street. But, it is easier to find parking around this place than say in the Richmond or Sunset.
author: Dan U.

description: I like how this place is not too far from my house. The dim sum is pretty good, not extraordinary, but good enough for my liking. The servers were pretty friendly as well, as they were good to keep an on eye on me and my friend on our recent visit. They did not keep us waiting that long for anything and were very attentive. I will come back here, mainly for the convenience factor.
author: April D.

description:
I have to say I am shocked at how different all the reviews are.  Bottom line, I think it's a matter of when you go.  I think the food is more fresh around noon, and best if you go on the weekend.  
I have to say that my family and I enjoy this tea house for many reasons.  The food is tasty, price is average, cleanliness is about as good as it gets (for a Chinese restaurant), free parking a plus, the service is friendly, and it's location is not too congested.  Yes, Chinatown, Richmond, and/or Sunset districts may have better restaurants, but traffic and parking is a pain!
author: Dee L.

description: Overpriced mediocre food. $15 for a plate of bland pea shoots. Ridiculous.
author: S. K.

description: We ate there last week,  the worst dim I've ever had and very expensive. I'm so disappointed that the food was terrible because it in my neighborhood. We even ordered Hong Kong chow mien that was terrible! save your money and go somewhere else to eat, I will never go there or recommend it to anyone. I would like to give it no star!
author: Sue D.

description: Came here on Chinese New year. I know its a holiday and its crowded an all. But they made me wait in line for 3 hours?!? And they weren't calling out the numbers. But when I finally got my table, they had no chairs left. I had to stand and wait there for an extra 15 mins. & I guess they "ran out of chairs." DO NOT COME HERE ON HOLIDAYS. Their food is alright. And the workers didn't really care about the customers. Worst customer service ever
author: Wanda L.

description: Food is decent with nice service and private parking lot.  It is a decent Chinese restaurant to eat and dim sum is not bad at all.  It is a clean Chinese restaurant with decent food.  Average place to dine around.  Not bad!
author: tomcat f.

description: I had dim sum here with a friend a few weeks ago.  The food was pretty tasty, but for no specific reason the ladies who circle the dining room floor with their various dim sum items decided to just speed by each time they approached our table.  Usually the dim sum experience at other restaurants has the cart lady stopping at your table or at the very least slowing down to see if you would like a dish of what she was offering.  Here, it was like hailing a taxi on a busy street.  My friend finally got p.o'd and asked for a check.  Then they took their time bringing us the check.  Prices are on the expensive side.  We left only half full.
author: Sara A.

description: its been a long long while since i came back to imperial nothing change. same people working, little amount of people eating.. i see more flies roaming around than people dining in, and the new thing is, they are remodeling a part of their restaurant. construction while people are dining in is not the business. i don't like to hear construction noise while i'm eating.. not a lot of selection at all. it's sad. why did i came back? because its nearby and theres a parking lot.
author: Valerie N.

description:
We have been here twice. Once on a friday evening for dinner, and once on sunday for dim sum. Gotta try all aspects of it out.. :) Dinner was pretty good. We were seated right away, this place is BIG, plenty of room. Lots of round tables in a large room. I had tofu and mussels crock pot dish... it was good but i didnt like the mussles. i think that was my fault, it was the big variety and i'd never tried them before. the sauce was yummy and so were the veggies and tofu. b ordered some fish dish which was good, and j got sweet and sour chicken which was better than i anticipated. it was all good but not wonderful, i thought. however, for $12 you can get the eggwhite rice and MMMMM i LOVE that stuff its like crack its so addicting. ive had it good at one other place and this place was just as good. so i ate way too much of that. 
Dim sum was worse than dinner. we came at 1 and it closes at 3 but it was very busy, but no line, we were seated right away. i liked having a dim sum place so easy to get to! the food was good, not great, but there was such a lack of variety. maybe it was the time. a lot of americanized food like fried chicken or those pork chops they kept pushing at us. we barely ate anything... and it was over $40 for 3 ppl. so too pricey for what we got. usually we pay that much and eat SO MUCH. we went home and made waffles with strawberries from scratch mmm. maybe i'll try it out again, if i'm up early, to see if there are more things i like.. there were a lot i missed... but maybe i'll just go someplace else. 
so overall, good not the greatest. i think dinner might be better. get that yummy eggwhite rice. and there's a parking lot.
author: Merredith L.

description: I came for dim sum and this place I used to really like. The food was pretty tasty, but the last time I came here the quality seemed to have gone down. Maybe we came here real late in the afternoon around 2pm. The food was not as fresh.
author: Leon C.

description: This is one of these huge ballroom-sized Chinese restaurants with big chandeliers, white tablecloths, pink napkins, and tanks of live sea creatures hoping you won't order them.  As a vegetarian, I can't speak to how well they "do" seafood, but the rest of their stuff is all right.  The menu makes for an interesting read -- fresh frog in clay pot, shark fin soup, etc. Great service, and neato lion statues at the front door.
author: Andi T.

description: I came here once before with my parents before I had my boys baptismal reception here & I'm glad my parents had it here because the food was delicious! Service was great! My parents come here regularly.  Thanks Uncle Bill for the great service & great food! The waiters, waitresses & hosts interacted with my guests.  It was nice of them.  We didn't have to wait long for food or any extra stuff.  I also had my newborn so they were able to make room for his stroller.  Honey walnut prawns was sooo good! I'm allergic to walnuts but I still ate it anyways! LOL...the halibut was so good to but one thing that sorta freaked me out was when they brought the chicken out the head was on the plate.  It was fried and it looked freaky I had to cover it up with the shrimp chip!
author: Angel G.

description: Just had lunch there.  I actually thought the food was pretty tasty.  I do like the fact that they have free parking, and they actually come by the tables to help plate the food for you.  I knocked off a couple stars because the food is pretty pricey for what you're getting and there were flies hovering around our table (never a good thing).  Btw, if you don't want to pay for tea, ask which tea(s) are no charge (otherwise they charge you $1 per person).
author: Ace V.

description:
Table of 7. Walked in on Christmas day and there were about 4 large tables open and few with dishes and trays that weren't cleaned up. We were told that they were setting up the table for us. 5 min later we were told the same thing. Another min they said the same thing again. 5 min later we asked them when will we be seated and the ladies at the cash register had to set up our tables. We sit and one dim sum cart arrives. As we waited for more, we notice many of them weren't coming to where we were. We then ask the "managers" in black if we can get a menu to order the dim sum directly. "oh there's no need for that. You can wait for the carts to go around. Plus there isn't a menu". As we waited for more food we asked one of the ladies if the had any Lotus wrapped chicken sticky rice and she  said she would have to place a special order to the kitchen and asked what else we wanted and that we can write it on the MENU. And guess who was the one who handed the menu to us? The "manager" who told us that a menu doesn't exist!

On another note, we asked for refill of tea. We asked another "manager" in black and he nodded and was in his way. Instead of refilling it, he stopped and talked to a friend or customer for a couple of minutes. Then he walks off and forgets about our tea. We then asked the "manager" who told us there was no menu and he ignored us a few times before realizing we needed a refill.

The food here is okay. Not the best. Customer service sucks horrible. Bad management and organization. Workers lack in their jobs. Prices is not cheap but reasonably priced higher than others.
author: Kevin V.

description: Certainly the best place on San Bruno for dim sum. Has a wide selection of menu items. Clean and spacious, bare bones decor, but not your hole in the wall at all. I would recommend this place if you're hankering for Chinese in the Portola.
author: Jenny W.

description: Great dimsum. Pricy... but better dimsum than 1/2 of the other dim sum resturants in San Francisco
author: Che M.

description: Been here for both DIM SUM & DINNER and both time it was horrible.  It's a "SIGN" when you walk in at night and the resturant is like 95% empty on a Friday night.  And yes, their dim sum sucks and it's pricey too for what you get.  Anyway, we won't be back.
author: John S.

description: The Hong Kong style seafood noodle dish here is great!  The service was friendly - they came by to refill our teapots and clear our dishes very frequently.  The siu mai here is really good as well.
author: Ling L.

description:
everybody is entitle to his/her opponent, but i really don't understand those who gave bad review on this restaurant. the restaurant serves FRESH dim sum that is not overwhelmed with MSG, sauces or oil. i also love their tea, it has a really nice aroma. on top of that, service is good and the prices are reasonable. my family was there on new years day, there were 5 of us. we were there for about an hour and a half, and the cost was around $75! and the place is spacious, well-lit and clean. what more can i say?!

my family and i have been going there for years and will continue doing so.
author: Julie Y.

description: no. food is gross :( ha gow is hard. uhh ... ugly place :( uhmm .. on the brighter side of things, theres a parking lot!
author: Judy L.
